intro: Scrophularia hajariana, commonly known as Hajarian figwort, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its erect stem and opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a distinctive two-lipped structure typical of the family. It is often found in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
